verb.description: (of a structure) fall down or in; give way.
examples: the roof collapsed on top of me

verb.description: (of a person) fall down and become unconscious, typically through illness or injury.
examples: he collapsed from loss of blood

verb.description: (of an institution or undertaking) fail suddenly and completely.
examples: in the face of such resolve his opposition finally collapsed

verb.description: Fold or be folded to fit into a small space.
examples: some cots collapse down to fit into a bag

noun.description: An instance of a structure falling down or in.
examples: the collapse of a railroad bridge
the church roof is in danger of collapse

origin: Early 17th century (as collapsed): from medical Latin collapsus, past participle of collabi, from col- together + labi to slip.
